paragraph.heading: 1Code Generation
paragraph.paragraph:
To generate Eiffel code representing your system, select Generate code from the Project menu or click
/images/eiffelbuild/icons/icon_code_generation_color.png on the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/10_general_interface_description/20_main_toolbars.xml main toolbar .

The length of time taken to generate your code will be dependent on the speed of the system you are running, and the size of your interface, but typically takes a couple of seconds. A progress bar will be displayed during the generation of your system.

The code will be generated according to the options you selected in the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/80_project_settings/index.xml project_settings (the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/80_project_settings/10_general.xml general tab displays the location of all generated files.)
paragraph.heading: 2Project build type
paragraph.paragraph:
If
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/80_project_settings/20_build.html#build_type build type is selected as Project in the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/80_project_settings/index.xml project_settings , then the following files will be generated:

list.item:
A class named as
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/80_project_settings/20_build.html#window_class_name window class name setting + '_IMP' representing the implementation of your window.

A class named as
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/80_project_settings/20_build.html#window_class_name window class name setting representing the interface of your window.

A class named as
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/80_project_settings/20_build.html#application_class_name application class name setting which is an EV_APPLICATION which will launch your window class.
An ace file "build_ace.ace" which will contain all the necessary information to compile your system.

/libraries/vision2/00_introduction.xml EiffelVision2 system, it is recommended that you use this option only when starting a new Vision2 system.
paragraph.note:
Note:To compile the generated system, start
/tools/eiffelstudio/index.xml EiffelStudio , select open existing ace from the initial dialog displayed and specify the newly generated ace.
paragraph.heading: 2Class build type
paragraph.paragraph:
If
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/80_project_settings/20_build.html#build_type build_type is selected as Class in the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/80_project_settings/index.xml project_settings , then the following files will be generated:

list.item:
A class named as
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/80_project_settings/20_build.html#window_class_name window class name setting + '_IMP' representing the implementation of your window.

A class named as
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/80_project_settings/20_build.html#window_class_name window class name setting representing the interface of your window.

Below is a

As the files generated are only sufficient for inclusion in an existing system, it is recommended that you use this option only when adding to an existing
/libraries/vision2/00_introduction.xml EiffelVision2 system.
paragraph.heading: 2Modifying code after generation
paragraph.paragraph: The choice to generate an interface and an implementation class for the window was to enable modification of the interface using EiffelBuild, once you had hand edited code. The rule is that the implementation window class will be re-generated every time, but the interface will not. It follows from this that you should not add hand written code to the implementation of the window, as any changes you make will be lost when re-generation takes place.

Using this mechanism, you can generate your initial system using EiffelBuild, and implement any event features that have been generated (in the interface) by EiffelBuild. If you then decide that you wish to modify the look and the feel of the interface, you can return to EiffelBuild, make the necessary adjustments and then re-generate the system.
paragraph.note: Note: When returning to EiffelBuild to modify the interface, if you delete or rename controls, then it is quite possible that you will break your existing code. Care should be taken with all changes of this type.
paragraph.paragraph:
Looking at a generated system, you will see that the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/40_object_editor/index.html#events events connected to your controls are defined as deferred in the implementation and actually implemented in the interface class. This means that if you return to EiffelBuild with a previously generated system, and add a new event to a control, then you will have to implement the definition in the interface class yourself (as the class interface class is not re-generated).
